meanings.definition: Ultraconservatives: those who hold extreme political views favoring traditional values and limited government intervention.
meanings.sent1: The ultraconservatives in the town always opposed any new laws.
meanings.sent2: The ultraconservatives gathered to discuss their beliefs in the community center.
meanings.sent3: The ultraconservatives joked that they would only accept new ideas if pigs could fly.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her as unyielding as the ultraconservatives in their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ultraconservatives holding onto the past was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: Ultraconservatives: characterized by a strong adherence to conservative principles and resistance to change.
meanings.sent1: The ultraconservatives viewpoint on the issue was clear and unwavering.
meanings.sent2: Her ultraconservatives approach to fashion never wavered over the years.
meanings.sent3: The ultraconservatives' refusal to try new foods became a running joke among friends.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood as ultraconservatives against the modern skyscrapers around it.
meanings.sent5: His ultraconservatives mindset was like a fortress against change.
